title: Senior-Staff-Sergeant (res.) Mordechai Haim Amoyal killed in Lebanon - Israel News - The Jerusalem Post
text: Chief Warrant Officer (res.) Mordechai Haim Amoyal was killed in combat on Thursday, during an exchange between Hezbollah terrorists and IDF Battalion 222 in southern Lebanon, Israel's military announced Thursday evening. ;Amoyal was 42 years old and a father of three children. He was from Israel's central city, Lod. ;An initial IDF probe stated that several Hezbollah terrorists emerged from a tunnel and hurled grenades at the troops. The soldiers returned fire, and four 2nd Carmeli Brigade soldiers were killed, including Amoyal. ;console.log("2390 BODY2. CatId is:"+catID);if(catID==120){ console.log("2390 BODY. author: Agence France-Presse
title: Global sea ice cover hits record low in February as world continues hot streak | The Manila Times
text:
PARIS ‚Äî Global sea ice cover reached a historic low in February, Europe's climate monitor said Thursday, with temperatures spiking up to 11C above average near the North Pole as the world continued its persistent heat streak.
Copernicus Climate Change Service said last month was the third hottest February, with planet-heating greenhouse gas emissions stoking global temperatures.
That helped push combined Antarctic and Arctic sea ice cover ‚Äî ocean water that freezes and floats on the surface ‚Äî to a record minimum extent of 16.04 million square kilometers on February 7, Copernicus said.
"February 2025 continues the streak of record or near-record temperatures observed throughout the last two years," said Samantha Burgess of the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts, which runs the Copernicus climate monitor.
"One of the consequences of a warmer world is melting sea ice, and the record or near-record low sea ice cover at both poles has pushed global sea ice cover to an all-time minimum."

author: Yesenia Santos
title: Por esta raz√≥n, veracruzano ya no competir√° en Juegos Ol√≠mpicos Par√≠s 2024 | La Silla Rota
text: XALAPA, VER. ‚Äì Los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos Par√≠s 2024 est√°n a unas horas de ser inaugurados de forma oficial en una ceremonia √∫nica, pues a diferencia de otros a√±os, esta ser√° con un paseo a trav√©s del popular Rio Sena en Francia. Atletas mexicanos, entre los que se encuentran veracruzanos, se encuentran prepar√°ndose para buscar una medalla ol√≠mpica, esto a excepci√≥n del xalape√±o Jos√© Antonio Chedraui Egu√≠a, quien ya no podr√° competir. De siete atletas veracruzanos, Jos√© Antonio Chedraui qued√≥ fuera de la competencia ol√≠mpica debido a problemas con su binomio. Fue a trav√©s de redes sociales que, la Federaci√≥n Ecuestre Mexicana (FEM) comparti√≥ un comunicado para explicar la raz√≥n de la baja del jinete xalape√±o. [√öNETE A NUESTRO CANAL DE WHATSAPP. EL PODER DE LA INFORMACI√ìN EN LA PALMA DE TU MANO](http://whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va5vqjjFXUuSaZbbly3G) Te podr√≠a interesar De acuerdo a lo informado, el binomio de Jos√© Antonio, H-Lucky Retto, una yegua de 12 a√±os de edad, se encuentra bajo tratamiento m√©dico, imposibilitando la participaci√≥n en los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos donde competir√≠an en la modalidad de salto. A su vez, se anunci√≥ que el binomio conformado por Federico Fern√°ndez Senderos y Romeo, competir√°n en sustituci√≥n de Jos√© y H-Lucky. ‚ÄúLamentamos informarles que el binomio Jos√© Antonio Chedraui Egu√≠a y H-Lucky Retto no participar√°n en los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos de Paris 2024 debido a que la yegua estar√° en tratamiento veterinario. El nuevo reserva del equipo ser√° el binomio compuesto por Federico Fern√°ndez y Romeo‚Äù, inform√≥ la FEM. [Ellos son los 7 atletas de Veracruz que llegar√°n a Juegos Ol√≠mpicos Par√≠s 2024](https://lasillarota.com/veracruz/vida/2024/7/10/ellos-son-los-atletas-de-veracruz-que-llegaran-juegos-olimpicos-paris-2024-491980.html) El xalape√±o Jos√© Antonio Chedraui, de 58 a√±os, participar√≠a en sus terceros Juegos Ol√≠mpicos, pues compiti√≥ en los de Atlanta de 1996 y de Beijing 2008. La noticia caus√≥ tristeza entre sus seguidores, mismos que expresaron su apoyo al jinete veracruzano. Los deportistas veracruzanos que siguen formando parte de la delegaci√≥n que representar√° a M√©xico en los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos son: Crisanto Grajales Valencia (Triatl√≥n), Kevin Berl√≠n Reyes (clavados-plataforma 10 metros), Kevin Mu√±oz (Clavados-trampol√≠n 3 metros), Kimberly Salazar (Gimnasio r√≠tmica), Ricardo Ortiz Rivera (Atletismo-marcha 20 kil√≥metros) y Sof√≠a Reinoso D√≠az Barriga (canotaje slalom). mb

author: world today news
title: Online Shopping Boom in Guadeloupe: Labor Impact Under Scrutiny
text:
Bulgarian E-commerce Lags Behind Rest of Europe, Data Shows While online shopping has become a global phenomenon, Bulgaria finds itself trailing behind much of the European Union when it comes to embracing the digital market. New data from Eurostat reveals that Bulgarians are lagging significantly in their adoption of e-commerce compared to their European counterparts.
While the EU average shows that 58.1% of people aged 16-74 have made online purchases in the three months leading up to the survey, Bulgaria paints a different picture.
"In just two EU regions, less than 1 in 5 people used e-commerce," the Eurostat data reveals. This puts Bulgaria‚Äôs southeastern region, which includes the capital city of Sofia, in last place within the continental EU. "In some areas, over 80% shop online," highlights the stark contrast between Bulgaria and leading regions in the EU.
Interestingly, Bulgaria‚Äôs southeastern region trails even the island territory of Guadeloupe, part of France in the Caribbean Sea, where 18.7% of the population shops online.
However, a glimmer of hope emerges in Bulgaria‚Äôs southwest region, which includes Sofia. Here, 37.5% of the population participates in online shopping, demonstrating a local surge in e-commerce activity.
This disparity in e-commerce adoption across the EU highlights the digital divide that persists. While regions in the Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Ireland, and the Czech Republic boast over 80% online shopper participation, Bulgaria has yet to catch up.
The reasons behind Bulgaria‚Äôs lagging e-commerce growth are multifaceted and may include factors such as limited access to reliable internet service in certain areas, a preference for traditional brick-and-mortar shopping, and a lack of trust in online platforms.
As Bulgaria continues to develop its digital infrastructure and e-commerce ecosystem, it faces both challenges and opportunities in bridging this digital gap and unlocking the full potential of online commerce.
2024-11-29 17:41:00
#shop #online #Guadeloupe #Labor
## Bulgaria‚Äôs E-Commerce‚Å§ Lag: Bridging the Digital‚Äã Divide
while online shopping has exploded across‚Äç Europe, Bulgaria remains significantly behind. New Eurostat data reveals a stark contrast between Bulgaria ‚Äçand leading EU regions, highlighting a persistent digital divide.This article dives deeper into the reasons behind Bulgaria‚Äôs lagging e-commerce growth and explores potential solutions with ‚Äçtwo leading experts.
joining us are‚Äå Dr. Maria Ivanova, a prominent economist specializing in digital market trends in‚Äç Eastern Europe, and Ivaylo Petrov, a leading Bulgarian tech entrepreneur focusing on e-commerce development. Together, ‚Å£we aim to ‚Äåshed light on the challenges and ‚Äåopportunities Bulgaria faces in unlocking the full potential of ‚Å§online commerce.
### Regional‚Å§ Disparities and the ‚Äúdigital Gap‚Äù
**Dr. Ivanova:** ‚ÄúThe Eurostat‚Äã data‚Å¢ paints a ‚Äåworrying ‚Äçpicture. Bulgaria‚Äôs southeastern region, wich includes Sofia, trails significantly behind other EU regions, with only 18.7% of the population engaging‚Å£ in online shopping. This puts it even behind Guadeloupe, a French overseas territory! This stark difference highlights a serious digital gap that needs to be addressed.‚Äù
**Petrov:** ‚Äúspli‚ÄùIt‚Äôs a complex issue with multifaceted factors. Internet access,particularly in rural areas,remains a challenge. Many Bulgarians still prefer the familiarity and convenience of ‚Äãtraditional brick-and-mortar stores.‚Äù
**What are the economic‚Äã implications of this digital‚Å£ divide?**
**Dr. Ivanova:** ‚ÄúThe low adoption rate of ‚Äãe-commerce hampers economic growth potential. It limits access to a wider market for Bulgarian businesses,both domestically and internationally. It also means‚Äå that Bulgarian consumers miss out on‚Äã potentially better prices, wider product selection, and the convenience of‚Å§ online shopping.‚Äù
### Overcoming Trust and infrastructure Barriers
‚ÄúWhat ‚Äåare‚Å§ some‚Å¢ of the key obstacles preventing Bulgarians from embracing e-commerce?
**Petrov:** ‚Äútrust plays a major role.‚Å¢ There‚Äôs a lingering skepticism towards online transactions and concerns about data security. Many Bulgarians are unfamiliar with digital payment platforms and prefer cash transactions.‚Äù
**Dr. Ivanova:** ‚ÄúInfrastructure limitations ‚Äãalso contribute to the problem. Slow and unreliable internet speeds in certain regions make online shopping impractical. ‚ÄãGoverment investment in expanding ‚Å¢broadband access, particularly in rural areas, is crucial.‚Äù
### The Swipe for Digital Future
**Petrov:** ‚Äå‚ÄùWe‚Äôre seeing positive trends in Bulgaria‚Äôs southwest region,‚Å§ with online shopping participation reaching 37.5%. This‚Äå suggests that as‚Å§ internet access improves and e-commerce‚Å£ platforms ‚Äãgain popularity, the situation can‚Äç change.
**Dr. ivanova: **‚Äù Bulgaria has a young ‚Äåand tech-savvy population that can drive the growth of ‚Å¢e-commerce.
Investing ‚Äçin digital literacy programs and promoting awareness about the benefits of online shopping are essential. ‚ÄçSupport for Bulgarian startups and ‚Å§e-commerce platforms is also critical for building a thriving digital economy.‚Äù
**Closing Thoughts**
as‚Å§ bulgaria works towards closing its digital divide, a collaborative approach ‚Å£involving government initiatives, private sector investment,‚Äå and ‚Å¢consumer education will be crucial.

with e-commerce in Bulgaria? Share your thoughts and experiences in the comments ‚Å§below!**

check out our articles on digital ‚Å¢innovation‚Å¢ and the growing startup scene in ‚Äåthe country.**

author: Paul McTaggart
title: Flood warnings still in place across Cumbria | News and Star
text: Three flood warnings are still in place in Cumbria following the heavy rain and stormy conditions. The warnings remain in place at Keswick Campsite, Rickerby Park, the River Eden at [Carlisle](/sport/football/carlisle-united/), and Swifts and Stoneyholm Golf Courses, according to the latest update. Seven flood alerts are also still in place across Cumbria, in which flooding is still possible with more rainfall expected to hit the region today (December 29). - Lower River Eden - Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster - Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck - Rivers Lowther and Eamont - Upper River Aire catchment - Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water - Upper River Lune 17 flood warnings have been removed in the last 24 hours. ‚ö†Ô∏è 7 flood alerts are still in place today! Flooding is possible.‚Äî Cumbria Flood Update (@CumbriaFloods) ‚ö†Ô∏è 3 flood warnings are in place today! Flooding is expected. ‚ùå 17 flood warnings removed [#CumbriaFloods] [#Cumbria] [pic.twitter.com/XA12XBoliZ] [December 28, 2023] - Lower River Lune and Conder - Middle River Eden - River North Tyne - River Rede - Rivers Caldew and Petteril - Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk - Rivers Esk and Irthing - Rivers Greta, St Johns Beck and Bassenthwaite Lake - Rivers Kent and Bela - Rivers Wampool and Ellen - Upper River Eden - Upper River Ribble, Hodder - Upper River Swale - Upper River Tees - Upper River Ure - Upper River Wear - Upper River Wharfe Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. [Read the rules here](/misc/comments)

author: Breaking News Desk
title: Breaking News LIVE: Around 100 flights delayed at IGI Airport, Delhi, due to fog - India
text: Latest news today (December 29): Presenting FE‚Äôs Breaking News today. We will keep you updated on all major news, views and much more throughout the day.President Droupadi Murmu has given her assent to a bill that seeks to put in place a mechanism for the appointment of Chief Election Commissioner and other Election Commissioners, according to a government notification issued Friday. The Chief Election Commissioner and Other Election Commissioners (Appointment, Conditions of Service and Term of Office) Bill, 2023, has provisions to set up a search committee chaired by the law minister and two other persons not below the rank of secretary, to prepare a panel of five persons for consideration of the selection committee for appointment as CEC or ECs.A massive fire broke out in a warehouse of a plastic and chemical factory situated in Badagaon locality in Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Gwalior district on Friday, an official said. The factory was situated in a residential area in the city here and was being operated illegally. On getting the information about the incident, the fire brigade team immediately rushed to the spot and started to douse off the fire. (ANI)Union Home Minister Amit Shah ‚Äôs followers on Instagram have crossed 10 million (one-crore) mark, with BJP sources saying their numbers saw a steep rise following the passage in Parliament of some landmark bills, including three legislations which overhaul criminal codes and laws. Shah, a key strategist of the party, has over 34.1 million followers on X, 10.7 million on Instagram and 15 million on Facebook, and he has been the most followed politician on social media after Prime Minister Narendra Modi. (PTI)Delhi Lieutenant Governor V K Saxena has given the green light to amendments in the Delhi Victims Compensation Scheme 2018, facilitating compensation for victims of mob violence and lynching. This move comes after a five-year delay, as the Delhi Government submitted the proposal following a Supreme Court directive in 2018, urging states to formulate such schemes within a month. The amendment broadens the definition of ‚Äòvictim‚Äô to encompass the guardian or legal heir of someone affected byHaryana government doctors initiated a strike on Friday, pushing for a specialist cadre formation and reduced bond amounts for postgraduate courses. Outpatient department (OPD) services were affected in some hospitals. This marks the second strike within the week, following the doctors‚Äô initial walkout on Wednesday.Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar clinched the Janata Dal (United) presidency during the Friday national executive meeting, succeeding Lalan Singh, who graciously proposed Kumar‚Äôs nomination. Party leader K C Tyagi disclosed these developments. The decisions made in the executive meeting are anticipated to be officially approved later at the national council meeting. Insider sources indicate widespread support within the party for Kumar, seen as its leading figure, to assume control during the crucial period preceding the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. It‚Äôs noteworthy that the Janata Dal (United) is affiliated with the opposition INDIA bloc, marking a significant political alignment.In a joint effort, the Emirates Red Crescent (ERC) and Egypt‚Äôs Misr El Kheir Foundation initiated a humanitarian project at the Zayed Charity Marathon in Egypt. This initiative involved the distribution of food parcels to 15,000 recipients located in the Giza and Fayoum Governorates, as well as Helwan in the Southern Area of Cairo.At least 100 flights were delayed and a few were canceled due to low visibility at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi on Friday. Airlines have requested passengers to keep a check on the status of flights on airline websites before leaving for the airport. Passengers who arrived at the airport but were not aware of the delays were seen sitting on the floors and waiting for an update from the airline.Preparations for the 75th Republic Day parade commenced in the national capital on Friday, with security forces conducting rehearsals despite the winter chill and foggy conditions near India Gate and Kartavya Path. As part of the lead-up to the upcoming Republic Day festivities, Delhi Police and security agencies are conducting mock drills at crucial installations and market areas. These exercises aim to enhance anti-terrorism measures and raise public awareness to remain vigilant.
